result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Antonio J Fernandez

records.addlTxt:
9:31 AM Defendant Antonio J Fernandez in court.  Prosecuting attorney Hector Al-Homsi in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is eligible for SPD but has not yet been appointed counsel, requested adjournment. No objection by State.
Status conference scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 02:20 pm.
Status conference on November 21, 2022 at 02:20 pm.

1:22 PM Defendant Antonio J Fernandez in court.  Prosecuting attorney Trisha L Simmons in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant has applied for SPD, but no one is appointed yet.  Case rescheduled.
Status conference scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Status conference on October 21, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Status conference on September 19, 2022 at 01:20 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without a valid license. 
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon [as defined by Wis. Stat. 939.22(10)]. 
Parties stipulated to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 2

09:08 AM Defendant appeared.  Tomas Fernando Valerio appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Status conference scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 01:20 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without a valid license. 
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon [as defined by Wis. Stat. 939.22(10)].
Bail/bond hearing on June 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
04:11 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Haley Ruesch Watson.  Will R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State has not yet filed Complaint. Parties stipulated to signature bond.
